p: The Lamiaceae contain many economically important species, used for their essential oils or as spices or herbs, including Ocimum (basil), Thymus (thyme), Origanum (oregano), Rosmarinus (rosemary), Mentha (peppermint, spearmint), Lavandula (lavender), Marrubium (horehound), Nepeta (catnip), Salvia (sage), and Satureja (savory). They are known as a rich source of plant antioxidants, especially phenolic acids and flavonoids.
